info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pecos, eastern Reeves and southeastern Ward Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1000 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Grandfalls, or 24 miles northwest of Fort Stockton, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Stockton, Firestone Test Track, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Coyanosa, B F Goodrich Testing Track and Imperial Reservoir. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 247 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
